intro: Ballota dictamnifolia, commonly known as the purple ballota, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, glandular leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its foliage emits a strong, spicy scent, which is attributed to the presence of essential oils. Ballota dictamnifolia is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
